item.title: Cartoon by Lisa Benson
item.description: Lisa Benson cartoon on Trump, tariffs refunds and American consumers.

item.title: ‘First Amendment rights have been restrained’
item.description: The Post prevails in court but the damage has already been done.

item.title: ‘People Power’ is not what ends dictatorships
item.description: The Philippines’ uprising 40 years ago has been romanticized. But Tiananmen Square is a better guide.

item.title: Don’t save Social Security
item.description: Trying to fix the retirement program is infeasible. Better to find new ways of achieving its goals.

item.title: What the escape of at least 15,000 detainees means for ISIS
item.description: The escapees fleeing al-Hol could create the next generation of Islamic State fighters.

item.title: How Trump raced past the Supreme Court
item.description: The justices took months to reject illegal tariffs. Trump took hours to sidestep their ruling.

item.title: ‘Trump really ruins a feel-good moment’: 10 writers on the State of the Union
item.description: They offered live commentary on the address starting at 8:45 p.m. Tuesday.

item.title: Trump tries to rewrite the history of trade
item.description: The administration misinterprets a Nixon-era law in its bid to reimpose tariffs struck down by the Supreme Court.

item.title: The military caused the DCA crash. Now it’s trying to kill key fixes.
item.description: The Pentagon plays last-minute games to torpedo a bipartisan Senate deal.

item.title: Roundup needs legal protections. This is the wrong way to do it.
item.description: Glyphosate’s link to cancer has long been tenuous at best.

item.title: Who is really driving ‘driverless’ vehicles?
item.description: Edward J. Markey on self-driving vehicles, parents on snow days and more

item.title: Cartoon by Matt Davies
item.description: Matt Davies cartoon on snow and energy bills.

item.title: I’m a doctor. Here’s what opened my mind about the future of medical care.
item.description: AI didn’t replace me as a doctor. It made me better.

item.title: Why is Trump blocking this bridge to Canada? Something stinks.
item.description: Turning down a fully built, Canadian-funded span would be economic malpractice.

item.title: Here’s the smartest way the U.S. can promote regime change in Iran
item.description: What is needed in this moment is the empowerment of the Iranian opposition.

item.title: Republicans in Colorado are actively defeating themselves
item.description: The GOP risks blowing its best opening to make gains in years.

item.title: A copper mine would turn much of this paradise into an industrial zone
item.description: A Senate vote could endanger some beautiful American backcountry.

item.title: Tariffs were illegal. Now Trump wants to delay refunds.
item.description: The government said small business would be made whole. It’s time to pay up.

item.title: ‘A disgrace’? Kavanaugh has a duty to defend the Supreme Court.
item.description: The justice can stand up for his colleagues Trump called “fools and lapdogs.”

item.title: RFK Jr.’s latest lies about vaccines could have major consequences
item.description: People are exposed to far more aluminum from food and drink than from vaccines.

item.title: Meddling with private business need not spiral after Trump
item.description: Susan Rice wants Democrats to go after companies that supposedly played nice with the president.

item.title: Price caps won’t make food more affordable
item.description: Neither will more government spending.

item.title: Privatize airport security
item.description: Government has a role, but private enterprises do it better.

item.title: Dismantling the cartels
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on killing of Mexican cartel leader El Mencho.

item.title: Can coffee really prevent dementia? Not so fast.
item.description: George Washington’s fashion, universities’ evolution and more, in readers’ eyes.
